com.example.mapnector.FirebaseCommunication

Class FirebaseHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.mapnector.FirebaseCommunication.FirebaseHelper

  • public class FirebaseHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    This class doe's almost nothing. it's aim is to manage and hold other Firebase classes so we can pass to other object only this one

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static User current
      User.class object that represents the current user(me, the guy who just logged in); the value of this object is set in fgs.DB_InitCurrentUser and its one of the most important variables of the app, so until we retrieve it we show dialog that not allows the user to do stuff in the app
      FirebaseGroupSystem fgs
      instance of FirebaseGroupSystem, communicates with firebase with stuff associated with group management(join, leave, init etc.)
      FirebaseLocationSystem fls
      instance of FirebaseLocationSystem, communicates with firebase with things that include location - retrieve location, get location etc
      static com.google.firebase.auth.FirebaseAuth mAuth 
      static com.google.firebase.database.DatabaseReference refGroups
      reference to Group table in firebase
      static com.google.firebase.database.DatabaseReference refRoot
      reference to root in firebase
      static com.google.firebase.database.DatabaseReference refUsers
      reference to Users table in firebase

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FirebaseHelper(AdapterManager ADmanager, UIHelper uiHelper, android.app.Activity activity)
      initializes the constants and fgs,fls

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void logout()
      call mAuth.signOut()

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
